intro: Cyrtandra caudiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Cyrtandra caudiflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires careful cultivation to thrive.
